column4: Hi,all,  I have 2 programs need to auto-start, I place them into /etc/rc.local, but one can start, and another failed to start. They both can start by hand when I call "/etc/rc.local" on command.
Now, I find the difference, But I dont know why?
My program is a socket server, it can auto-start in /etc/rc.local on my PC, but it cannot auto-start on my VMware.
My OS is both ubuntu-9.04 on my PC and VMware.
when I disgard the '&', it can auto-start.
but On my pc, I can auto-start with '&' and without '&'
you shouldn't need the & in rc.local
yes, I said I found this difference.
But why on My PC it can start with '&'
so does that mean it works or not?
I can work with '&' and without '&' on my PC; but it cannot works with '&' on my VMware.
I'm confused, I thought we were just working with one OS (and rc.local)
another difference is about the OS installation mode, my PC is installed over network. but the VMware is installed by ubtuntu.iso image file.
the deference is about the accounts priviledge.
I'm not entirely sure I know what you mean, but I have to go :( sorry
